intro: Paederotella daghestanica, commonly known as the Daghestan pug. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Caucasus region, specifically found in the mountainous areas of Daghestan. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
